text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today I am 
making another one of my mother's requests she's

been on a roll lately with her requests so this 
is a great summer dessert that's quite popular

in Thailand right now and it's called tao hu nom sod 
now tao hu is tofu and nom sod is milk so essentially

it is what I would call milk tofu but in English 
I think it's better to call it milk pudding and

we use the term tofu because the texture at the 
end is very similar to very soft tofu but it's

made from milk very easy it's cute and it's so 
refreshing in hot weather like this so let's get

started all right so one of the setting agents 
we are using is gelatin so I've got here just

powdered gelatin unflavored when you're using 
powdered gelatin you want to hydrate it first

in water so I'm putting some of the water into a 
little Bowl and then you're just going to sprinkle

the gelatin right on top like this and then we'll 
let it sit for about five to 10 minutes and then

this will just bloom and hydrate and then it 
will dissolve a lot more easily so the rest of

my water I'm going to put it in a small pot and 
then we're going to add the second setting agent

and that is of course agar agar my favorite jello 
fiying ingredients in the world and if you don't

know what a gauger is I have a whole video that 
explains what it is and how to use it I'll make

sure to link to that all right one of the and that 
don't spill stuff into the pot okay just stir that

and then I'm going to add my milk so this is just 
whole milk regular milk and then I'm going to add

whipping cream some people in Thailand like to 
use evaporated milk instead of whipping cream and

I've done that too and it's good but I prefer the 
flavor of whipping cream better so now I'm going

to bring this to a boil because Agha Agha really 
needs to boil before it will melt completely and

make sure you stir it because if you don't stir it 
the auger will set at the bottom and then you'll

get the thick layer of gel stuck to the bottom 
of the pod now once it comes to a boil you want

to let it simmer for about one minute just to make 
sure the our gars dissolved completely so now I'm

going to add my gelatin so it should have had at 
least five minutes to sit by now you don't want

to add gelatin and then let it boil because the 
prolonged heat exposure will actually compromise

the gelatin strength so that's why we turn the 
heat off and then we put the gelatin in just

going to rinse this to make sure we get every last 
bit out and now you want to give this a stir for

another one to two minutes it does take gelatin 
awhile to dissolve into hot liquid now I'm going

to sweeten this mixture with sweetened condensed 
milk you can add as much as you like really

whether you like it sweeter less sweet so we've 
got here three different milk products in here

so in some ways you could call this a tres leches 
pudding and these are my serving cups aren't they

cute so you can use whatever cups you want but I 
would suggest do single serving size okay because

we're not going to unmold this so the jelly is 
gonna set in here we're gonna serve it in here

okay so I'm gonna pour this in but I'm not gonna 
fill it all the way up because you want to have

room to put our toppings in the sauce now why 
did I use both gelatin and agar agar I forgot

to explain to you so the two gelling agents give 
very different texture augers firm gelatin is very

bouncy and jiggly so by combining the two you 
actually get a texture that's sort of halfway

in between and I'm not using a lot I'm using very 
little of each so to be very soft with a little

bounce yet firm enough that it will set at room 
temperature without melting and that's a benefit

of agar agar that I like to use because if you're 
serving this out on a hot summer day gelatin will

melt very quickly but agar agar is solid at room 
temperature so you don't have to worry so much

about the serving condition right so in Thailand 
a lot of people will do it with just agar agar so

that's possible too if you want to serve this to 
vegetarians however I like the extra bounciness

from the gelatin so I like to do a bit of both 
okay in the fridge it goes Unum so it is always

served with a sauce which is essentially just 
a liquid version of what we just made okay the

exact same ingredients but the whole point of it 
is to sort of moisten the whole eating experience

a little bit so instead of eating you know a block 
of dry jelly like thing now there's moisture going

around okay so I've got here some milk and 
I'm going to add some whipping cream to it

DejaVu and some condensed milk so as of now our 
pudding is just milk flavored but if you want a

flavour with something else like vanilla almond 
extract would be good too or even mint extract

anything you like you can go ahead and add just 
a couple of drops of extracts to both the pudding

and the sauce alright so I'm going to let this 
chill in the fridge and then let's talk about

toppings because that's very important so when 
it comes to toppings most people go with fruits

some people do things like beans or grains like 
barley but I much prefer fruit because I think

the milk really needs the bright freshness of the 
fruits so but you can only whatever kind of fruit

you want I'm going to show you my favorite 
so strawberries I love the way strawberries

go well with milk I mean strawberries and cream 
hello this odd-looking bowl here I talked about

it before this is Thai lemon basil seeds and there 
are little black seeds so what you do is you soak

them into hot water and after about 10 minutes 
or so they'll swell up and become sort of like a

gel but with crunchy seeds inside you can also use 
chia seeds chia seeds will do the exact same thing

but they won't swell quite as much next moving 
on is jackfruit now I have a video about how

to peel a jackfruit and all this did I filmed in 
Thailand a while back so you can check that out if

you're not familiar with the fruit but this one is 
canned and canned jackfruit is available in lots

of different Asian grocery stores and all I did 
was I just cut them up into little little pieces

okay cuz we've got you know little puddings the 
last one is my absolute favorite this is called

beikoku okay it's a product that originated from 
the Philippines and what this is is actually a

bacterial fermentation byproduct of coconut water 
so the way they make it is they let coconut water

ferment and as the bacteria slowly turn it into 
vinegar they create they built this gel on top

of the coconut water to protect themselves from 
the elements and then humans go oh I wonder if

that gel tastes any good Oh what do you know it 
does and so people started cultivating it and

it's God is really interesting an interesting 
chewy firm texture and so what I do is I cut it

up into smaller pieces just so it works better 
with our tiny little puddings all right let's

put it together so the jelly has set and if 
you touch it you should be very soft a little

bit bouncy it should just barely hold together 
that's the the charm of this pudding super soft

and now I'm going to put the sauce on and I like 
to put the sauce on after because I put the sauce

on first and the fruit starts floating around in 
the sauce is really hard to arrange look at cute

that is if you want you can put a little mint leaf 
on it for a little extra green but I'm totally

happy with that and for a tiny pudding you need a 
tiny spoon oh it's like the perfect combination of

fruity and milky and it's super light this is if 
you're thinking panna cotta this is miles lighter

than panna cotta and it's almost not a solid you 
know it just like melts in your mouth as you try

it oh it's so good and it's so cute look at it 
I just love it so much so I hope you give this

a try definitely send me a photo once you've 
made it on Facebook Twitter or Instagram and

the recipe will be on hot Thai Kitchen calm if 
you haven't subscribed to the show please do so

right here so you'll never miss an episode and I 
will see you next time for your next delicious hi
